message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the capacity of a discrete memoryless channel, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). The use of random variables and the analysis of their convergence suggests a connection to probability and statistics (cs.PR). The application of the results to Bayesian optimal experiment design suggests a connection to machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The use of entropy and information measures suggests a connection to signal processing (cs.SP) and the analysis of algorithms (cs.DS). Finally, the study of channel capacity and its convergence suggests a connection to computer communications (cs.CC).
